name: GO Consortium Enrichment Tool
description: A tool for GO term enrichment analysis.

name: AmiGO 2
description: The GO Consortium GO browser and search engine.
function: Functional enrichment [operation_2436]|Protein sequence comparison [operation_2509]|Search and retrieval [operation_0224]|Ontology visualisation [operation_3559]

name: QuickGO
description: A fast browser for Gene Ontology terms and annotations.

name: GONUTS
description: Third-party documentation for new users of GO.

name: Ontology Lookup Service
description: Ontology Lookup Service (OLS) is a web service interface to query multiple ontologies.

name: InterProScan
description: Protein sequence analysis and classification

name: Generic GO Term Mapper
description: A tool for mapping the granular GO annotations for genes in a list to a set of broader, high-level GO parents terms.

name: Generic GO Term Finder
description: A tool for finding significant GO terms shared among a list of genes from your organism of choice.

name: g:Profiler
description: A public web server for characterising and manipulating gene lists of high-throughput genomics.

name: BiNGO
description: A Java-based tool to determine which GO categories are statistically overrepresented in a set of genes or a subgraph in a biological network.

name: Bioconductor
description: Bioconductor provides tools for the analysis and comprehension of high-throughput genomic data.

name: Ontologizer
description: A Tool for Statistical Analysis and Visualization of High-Throughput Biological Data Using Gene Ontology

name: GOrilla
description: GOrilla is a tool for identifying and visualizing enriched GO terms in ranked lists of genes.
topic: Ontology and terminology [topic_0089]|Functional genomics [topic_0085]|Molecular interactions, pathways and networks [topic_0602]

name: Artemis
description: Artemis is a free genome browser and annotation tool that allows visualisation of sequence features, next generation data and the results of analyses within the context of the sequence, and also its six-frame translation.

name: DISCOVAR
description: DISCOVAR is a variant caller designed for state-of-the-art data. DISCOVAR can call variants on a region by region basis, potentially tiling an entire large genome. DISCOVAR variant calling is under active development and transitioning to VCF.

name: DISCOVAR de novo
description: DISCOVAR de novo is a genome assembler designed for state-of-the-art data. DISCOVAR de novo can generate de novo assemblies for both large and small genomes. It currently does not call variants.

name: FASTX-Toolkit
description: The FASTX-Toolkit is a collection of command line tools for Short-Reads FASTA/FASTQ files preprocessing.

name: FGENESH
description: HMM-based gene structure prediction (multiple genes, both chains); Program for predicting multiple genes in genomic DNA sequences.

name: GeneMark
description: A family of gene prediction programs: Gene Prediction in Bacteria, Archaea, Metagenomes and Metatranscriptomes; Gene Prediction in Eukaryotes; Gene Prediction in Transcripts; Gene Prediction in Viruses, Phages and Plasmids.

name: Glimmer
description: Glimmer is a system for finding genes in microbial DNA, especially the genomes of bacteria, archaea, and viruses. Glimmer (Gene Locator and Interpolated Markov ModelER) uses interpolated Markov models (IMMs) to identify the coding regions and distinguish them from noncoding DNA.

name: GREAT
description: GREAT predicts functions of cis-regulatory regions. Many coding genes are well annotated with their biological functions. Non-coding regions typically lack such annotation. GREAT assigns biological meaning to a set of non-coding genomic regions by analyzing the annotations of the nearby genes.

name: GSEA
description: Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) is a computational method that determines whether an a priori defined set of genes shows statistically significant, concordant differences between two biological states (e.g. phenotypes).
function: Differential gene expression analysis [operation_3223]|Gene expression correlation analysis [operation_3463]|Over-representation analysis [operation_3501]

name: IGB
description: IGB (Integrated Genome Browser) is a fast, free, and highly customizable genome browser for viewing and exploring big genomic datasets.

name: Picard tools
description: Picard is a set of command line tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data and formats such as SAM/BAM/CRAM and VCF.

name: RSeQC
description: RSeQC (RNA-seq Quality Control) package provides a number of useful modules that can comprehensively evaluate high throughput sequence data especially RNA-seq data. Some basic modules quickly inspect sequence quality, nucleotide composition bias, PCR bias and GC bias, while RNA-seq specific modules evaluate sequencing saturation, mapped reads distribution, coverage uniformity, strand specificity, transcript level RNA integrity etc.

name: RStudio
description: RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for the R programming language.
topic: Mathematics [topic_3315]|Data architecture, analysis and design [topic_3365]|Statistics and probability [topic_2269]

name: SortMeRna
description: SortMeRNA: a sequence analysis tool for filtering, mapping and OTU-picking NGS reads.
function: Sequence similarity search [operation_0346]|Sequence alignment analysis [operation_0258]|Sequence comparison [operation_2451]

name: Trim Galore!
description: A wrapper tool around Cutadapt and FastQC to consistently apply quality and adapter trimming to FastQ files, with some extra functionality for MspI-digested RRBS-type (Reduced Representation Bisufite-Seq) libraries.

name: WebLogo
description: WebLogo is a web based application designed to make generate sequence logos.
topic: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs [topic_3511]

name: WGCNA
description: Functions necessary to perform Weighted Correlation Network Analysis on high-dimensional data. Includes functions for rudimentary data cleaning, construction of correlation networks, module identification, summarization, and relating of variables and modules to sample traits. Also includes a number of utility functions for data manipulation and visualization.
